nodes.title: How to Add Google Map in Magento 2 Page?
nodes.excerpt: This article focuses on the benefits of integrating Google Maps into an eCommerce website for businesses with physical storefronts and provides guidance on How to Add Google Map in Magento 2 Page. It highlights how this integration can aid online shoppers in making informed decisions and create new business opportunities for merchants. Additionally, it provides … Read more
nodes.content:
This article focuses on the benefits of integrating Google Maps into an eCommerce website for businesses with physical storefronts and provides guidance on How to Add Google Map in Magento 2 Page. It highlights how this integration can aid online shoppers in making informed decisions and create new business opportunities for merchants. Additionally, it provides step-by-step instructions on how Magento 2 store owners can easily integrate Google Maps into their websites.

How to Add Google Map in Magento 2 Page? A Step-by-Step Guide

Why should you embed Google Map to your website?

The goal of integrating Google Maps onto a website is to make it easy for customers to find a physical store. Although online shopping has become increasingly popular, many shoppers still prefer in-store shopping.

Adding a Google Map to a website offers more than just informing customers about the store location. It also:

  • Simplifies the process of searching for store locations by allowing customers to use the map directly on the site
  • Provides full business contact information, such as phone number, website, reviews, and ratings
  • Increases the time visitors spend on the site, providing opportunities to convert them into customers
  • Recommend and highlight nearby points of interest, parks, and restaurants, which can help visitors better understand the store’s physical location
  • Functions as a fully functional Google Map app on smartphones, ensuring customers can always find the business

Increases shopper’s trust and confidence in the business by displaying the exact location and contact information on Google Maps

Builds brand visibility and credibility by highlighting multiple physical store locations on the map.

In summary, integrating Google Maps into an eCommerce website offers numerous benefits, including making it easier for customers to find the physical store, providing contact information, and increasing shopper trust and confidence.

How to add Google Map in Magento 2 store?

Typically, Magento 2 store owners often choose to include Google Maps on their About Us or Contact Us pages to display their physical store locations and provide directions to online visitors.

Add Google Map in Magento 2 with default Page Builder

In Magento 2 Commerce Edition, merchants have the option to add a Google Map block to their About Us and Contact Us pages using the Page Builder features. However, before adding the map, they must create a billing account or project on Google Maps Platform and activate the Google Maps Javascript API. Once these steps are completed, they will receive an API key, which they can then use to configure the map in Magento 2. Additionally, to optimize page load speed, it’s recommended to combine Javascript files, and this article will guide you on How to Combine Javascript files in Magento 2.

Step 1: Add the Google Map API Key in the Store Backend

  • Log in to the Admin dashboard and navigate to Stores > Settings > Configuration > Content Management > Advanced Content Tools.
  • Paste your API key in the Google Maps API Key field and click the Test Key button to verify its correctness and usability.
  • If you are unsure how to obtain the API key, follow the instructions from Google Maps.

Step 2: Add Google Map to a Magento 2 Page

  • Go to Content > Pages in the left sidebar.
  • Select the page where you want to add the Google Map,
  •  click Edit in the Action column. The Page Builder will appear in the Content section.
  • In the Page Builder panel, select Media. Drag and drop the Map option to the stage. If Google Maps Platform is not configured for your store, the map will not be displayed.

Step 3:To add store locations to the map:

  • Move the mouse to the map container to access the toolbox.
  • Click on the Setting icon to open the Edit Map page.
  • In the upper-right corner, click the Add Location button.
  • Fill in the location name and the exact coordinates in Google Maps.
  • Add any additional relevant information to associate with the map location.

To find the coordinates of a location:

  • Open the Google Maps website.
  • Search for the location.
  • The coordinates can be found in the URL.

Step 4: Customize the Map’s Appearance

  • Access the configuration settings by navigating to Stores > Settings > Configuration > General > Content Management > Advanced Content Tools.
  • Click on the “Create Map Style” button under the Google Maps Style field.
  • Choose “Create a Style” and set the map’s appearance to your desired style (e.g., feature density, theme, etc.).
  • When finished, click on the “Finish” button.
  • Export the completed style as either a JSON code or URL, then add it to the Magento 2 configuration.
  • Paste the code or URL into the Google Maps Style field.
  • Save the configuration changes by clicking on the “Save Config” button to display the customized map on your website.

The bottom line!

Modern consumers consider Google Maps to be a crucial tool in guiding their decisions, providing them with essential information such as addresses, contact information, and brand ratings. For businesses looking to expand in the future, having a presence on Google Maps is vital as its popularity continues to grow among today’s users.

Please follow and like us:
Aaron Jenkins

I am Aaron Jenkins, a Magento Developer with over 12+ years of experience. I specialize in Magento 2 and I am passionate about sharing my knowledge and experience through my blog. Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.

nodes.title: How to Integrate QuickBooks Online with Magento 2
nodes.excerpt: How to Integrate QuickBooks Online with Magento 2: To integrate Magento 2 with QuickBooks Online, you can use a third-party integration app like FastBooks or QBO Integration for Magento 2. These apps allow you to connect your Magento 2 store with your QuickBooks Online account and automatically synchronize sales, invoices, payments, and other financial data. … Read more
nodes.content:
How to Integrate QuickBooks Online with Magento 2: To integrate Magento 2 with QuickBooks Online, you can use a third-party integration app like FastBooks or QBO Integration for Magento 2. These apps allow you to connect your Magento 2 store with your QuickBooks Online account and automatically synchronize sales, invoices, payments, and other financial data. By using a Magento 2 extension QuickBooks integration, you can also set up rules to control which data gets synced and how it is formatted, ensuring that your accounting information stays accurate and up-to-date. With this integration, you can save time and reduce manual errors, giving you more time to focus on growing your business and improving your Magento 2 QuickBooks integration.

How to Integrate QuickBooks Online with Magento 2: A Comprehensive Guide

What is QuickBooks Online?

Are you looking for a way to streamline your financial data and processes for your Magento 2 store? QuickBooks Online may be the solution you need. In this article, we’ll explore how to integrate QuickBooks Online with Magento 2. QuickBooks Online is a comprehensive accounting platform that helps small businesses manage their finances with ease. With its cloud-based technology, you can easily track your income and expenses, as well as monitor the financial health of your business. From paying bills, generating invoices, creating reports, and preparing taxes, QuickBooks Online offers a variety of features to help you manage your finances.

Intuit developed and manages the platform, which comes equipped with web-based capabilities such as online banking, remote payroll support, electronic payment options, and mail functionality. The platform is user-friendly and suitable for business owners with limited accounting or financial experience, with a simple operating system and ready-made templates for easy financial data access.

To connect to QuickBooks Online, you can use one of the many available Magento 2 extensions for QuickBooks Online integration. These extensions allow you to connect your Magento 2 store with your QuickBooks Online account and automatically synchronize sales, invoices, payments, and other financial data. You can also set up rules to control which data gets synced and how it is formatted, ensuring that your accounting information stays accurate and up-to-date. With this integration, you can save time and reduce manual errors, giving you more time to focus on growing your business.

5 Benefits of integrating QuickBooks Online with Magento 2

The integration between Magento and QuickBooks provides numerous benefits to help streamline your store management. Some of the key advantages include: 

1. Streamline Data Management: The integration between Magento and QuickBooks Online eliminates the hassle of managing data manually, saving you time and money on manual data entry.

2. Real-time Bookkeeping Reports: QuickBooks Online integration provides real-time insights into your business performance through customizable dashboards and reports. It also makes it easy to track expenses by saving receipts and snapshots.

3. Efficient Cash Flow & Form Management: The integration simplifies the process of scheduling recurring payments and creating custom invoices, sales receipts, and estimates, saving you time and reducing the risk of manual errors.

4. Minimize Mistakes: Human errors are inevitable, but the integration of Magento and QuickBooks Online helps to minimize them, reducing the risk of inaccuracies in your financial data.

5. Focus on Business Growth: The integration streamlines your work process, freeing up time for you to focus on growing your online business and executing other critical tasks.

How to Integrate QuickBooks Online with Magento 2

To integrate QuickBooks Online with Magento 2, you can use an integration service such as How to Integrate QuickBooks Online with Magento 2. Pre-built integration extensions may not always satisfy all your requirements. Youâ€™ll need a wide range of customizations to make the integration work the way you like. So, a custom integration service becomes useful.

By having a well-known and reliable integration service handle the QuickBooks Online integration process for you, you can save a lot of time and effort. Moreover, you can rest assured that the process is successful.

Webguru experts are capable of integrating your Magento store with any third-party platform to make it much more powerful. In addition to QuickBooks Online, we also have in-depth knowledge and experience in other integrations, such as Zoho CRM, Freshsales, Salesforce CRM, etc. We can make the integration process easy and cost-effective.”

integration process includes five steps only:

1. requirement analysis

2. Project proposal & consultancy

3. project implementation

4. Quality assurance & UAT (User acceptance testing)

5. Ongoing Support & Maintenance

Our experience in the Magento world spans nearly a decade

1. Dedicated Magento developers: Since 2014, our developers have implemented numerous Magento integrations, providing pre-built extensions and custom integration services for clients worldwide.

2. On-time delivery: Our experts always adhere to strict timelines to deliver your project on time, ensuring that your investment is worth every penny.

3. Transparent process: Our Magento integration service allows you to modify the scope and track progress, with a completely transparent process.

4. Five-star support: Our support team is always available to assist with any queries or concerns, with free 2-month post-release support for our integration service.

5. Budget-friendly cost: Our integration extension and service are affordable for startups and SMBs, with cost-effective solutions guaranteed.

Conclusion

In this article, you have been introduced to the steps for integrating Magento 2 with QuickBooks Online, as well as How to Use a Custom Price Template in Magento 2. The integration creates a streamlined digital environment for you to gather, evaluate, and control your data, leading to improved productivity and efficiency.

If you have any questions regarding the Magento integration or How to Use a Custom Price Template in Magento 2, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us. We’ll respond promptly. Thank you for reading!

nodes.title: How to create a Widget Programmatically in Magento 2
nodes.excerpt: Magento 2 is a popular e-commerce platform that allows you to create a wide range of widgets for your online store. Widgets are small pieces of code that can be added to your website to display various types of content, such as product lists, featured products, promotions, customer reviews, and much more.  They can be … Read more
nodes.content:
Magento 2 is a popular e-commerce platform that allows you to create a wide range of widgets for your online store. Widgets are small pieces of code that can be added to your website to display various types of content, such as product lists, featured products, promotions, customer reviews, and much more. 

They can be placed anywhere on your website, such as on CMS pages, blocks, or even on the homepage. By using widgets, you can easily showcase your products and services in an attractive and user-friendly way. Additionally, creating a widget programmatically in Magento 2 is a great way to extend the functionality of your store and make it more user-friendly. 

This allows you to customize the look and feel of your Magento 2 website to meet your specific needs and requirements, as well as make it easier for your customers to find what they’re looking for. With the power of widgets, you can set up Magento 2 and create a unique and engaging online shopping experience for your customers.

In this blog, we will discuss how to create a widget programmatically in Magento 2, step by step.

Steps to create a widget programmatically in Magento 2 

Step 1: Create the Widget Directory

The first step in creating a widget programmatically in Magento 2 is to create a directory for your widget. The directory should be created in the “app/code” directory of your Magento 2 installation. The directory structure should look like this:

bash

app/code/Vendor/Module/

Where “Vendor” is the name of your company and “Module” is the name of your module.

Step 2: Create the Widget Class

Once you have created the widget directory, you need to create the widget class. The widget class is responsible for defining the functionality of your widget. You should create the widget class in the following location:

bash

app/code/Vendor/Module/Block/Widget/MyWidget.php

Here is an example of what your widget class could look like:

php

<?php

namespace Vendor\Module\Block\Widget;

use Magento\Framework\View\Element\Template;

use Magento\Widget\Block\BlockInterface;

class MyWidget extends Template implements BlockInterface

{

    protected $_template = "widget/mywidget.phtml";

    public function getHelloWorld()

    {

        return 'Hello World!';

    }

}

In this example, the widget class extends the “Magento\Framework\View\Element\Template” class, which provides the basic functionality for creating a widget. The widget class also implements the “Magento\Widget\Block\BlockInterface” interface, which allows Magento to recognize the class as a widget.

Step 3: Create the Widget Template

Next, you need to create the widget template. The widget template is responsible for defining the appearance of your widget. You should create the widget template in the following location:

bash

app/code/Vendor/Module/view/frontend/templates/widget/mywidget.phtml

Here is an example of what your widget template could look like:

php

<div>

    <?php echo $this->getHelloWorld(); ?>

</div>

In this example, the widget template calls the “getHelloWorld” method of the widget class, which returns the string “Hello World!”.

Step 4: Create the Widget XML Configuration

Finally, you need to create the widget XML configuration. The widget XML configuration is responsible for defining the configuration options for your widget. You should create the widget XML configuration in the following location:

bash

app/code/Vendor/Module/etc/widget.xml

Here is an example of what your widget XML configuration could look like:

xml

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<widgets xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSche

php

<widgets xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="urn:magento:module:Magento_Widget:etc/widget.xsd">

    <widget id="vendor_module_mywidget" class="Vendor\Module\Block\Widget\MyWidget">

        <label translate="true">My Widget</label>

        <description translate="true">A sample widget created programmatically in Magento 2</description>

        <parameters>

            <parameter name="title" xsi:type="text" required="false" default="My Widget Title">

                <label translate="true">Title</label>

                <description translate="true">The title of the widget</description>

            </parameter>

        </parameters>

        <template>widget/mywidget.phtml</template>

        <type>cms</type>

    </widget>

</widgets>

In this example, the “id” attribute of the “widget” element defines the unique identifier for the widget. The “class” attribute defines the widget class that we created in Step 2. The “label” and “description” elements define the label and description of the widget, which will be displayed in the Magento admin panel. The “parameters” element defines the configuration options for the widget, in this case a single “title” option. The “template” element defines the widget template that we created in Step 3. The “type” element defines the type of widget, in this case a “cms” widget, which can be added to a CMS page or block.

Step 5: Declare the Module

Finally, you need to declare your module by creating the following file:

bash
app/code/Vendor/Module/etc/module.xml

Here is an example of what your module declaration could look like:

xml

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="urn:magento:framework:Module/etc/module.xsd">

    <module name="Vendor_Module" setup_version="1.0.0">

    </module>

</config>

In this example, the “name” attribute of the “module” element defines the name of your module, which should match the directory structure that you created in Step 1. The “setup_version” attribute defines the version of your module.

Step 6: Upgrade the Magento Installation

Finally, you need to upgrade your Magento installation to make sure that the new module and widget are recognized. You can upgrade your Magento installation by running the following command in the command line:

python

php bin/magento setup:upgrade

After upgrading your Magento installation, you should be able to see your new widget in the Magento admin panel under “Content > Widgets”. You can then add the widget to a CMS page or block to display it on your website.

conclusion

In conclusion, creating a widget programmatically in Magento 2 is a great way to extend the functionality of your store and make it more user-friendly. By following the steps outlined in this blog, you can create a custom widget that can display a wide range of content on your website.

Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.

nodes.title: How to Add URL Rewrite Programmatically in Magento 2
nodes.excerpt: Magento 2 is a popular e-commerce platform that offers an array of features and functionalities for merchants to manage their online store. One crucial aspect of an online store is the URL structure, which can impact the search engine rankings and user experience. URL rewriting is a feature of Magento 2 that enables merchants to … Read more
nodes.content:
Magento 2 is a popular e-commerce platform that offers an array of features and functionalities for merchants to manage their online store. One crucial aspect of an online store is the URL structure, which can impact the search engine rankings and user experience. URL rewriting is a feature of Magento 2 that enables merchants to create custom, SEO-friendly URLs for their products, categories, and other pages. Custom URLs can improve the search engine rankings, increase brand recognition, and provide a better user experience for customers.Â 

In this blog, we will delve into the process of how to add URL rewrite programmatically in Magento 2, exploring the steps and benefits of this process. You can also read, how to effectively use URL rewrite Functionality in Magento 2.

Why Add URL Rewrite Programmatically in Magento 2?

Adding URL rewrites programmatically in Magento 2 offers several benefits, including:

Improved SEO: 

Custom, SEO-Friendly URLs can improve your search engine rankings and increase visibility for your online store.

Better User Experience: 

Custom URLs make it easier for customers to find the products they’re looking for, leading to a better overall experience.

Increased Brand Awareness: 

Custom URLs that reflect your brand and product offerings can help to increase brand awareness and recognition.

How to Add URL Rewrite Programmatically in Magento 2:

To add URL rewrites programmatically in Magento 2, follow these steps:

1. Open your Magento 2 store’s code editor and navigate to the location where you want to add the URL rewrite.

2.  Create a new URL rewrite object using the following code:

bash

$rewrite = $this->urlRewriteFactory->create();

1. Set the parameters for the URL rewrite. For example, to create a URL rewrite for a product, you can use the following code:

scss

$rewrite->setStoreId(1)

        ->setIsSystem(0)

        ->setIdPath('product/123')

        ->setTargetPath('catalog/product/view/id/123')

        ->setRequestPath('product-123.html')

        ->setDescription('Product 123');

Note: In the above example, “product/123” is the ID path, “catalog/product/view/id/123” is the target path, “product-123.html” is the request path, and “Product 123” is the description.

    1. Save the URL rewrite using the following code:

scss

$rewrite->save();

Conclusion:

Adding URL rewrites programmatically in Magento 2 is a powerful way to improve the SEO and user experience of your online store. By following the steps outlined in this blog, you can easily create custom, SEO-friendly URLs for your products, categories, and other pages. Whether you’re looking to increase visibility for your online store or simply improve the overall user experience, add URL rewrite programmatically in Magento 2 is a simple and effective solution.

Please follow and like us:
Aaron Jenkins

I am Aaron Jenkins, a Magento Developer with over 12+ years of experience. I specialize in Magento 2 and I am passionate about sharing my knowledge and experience through my blog. Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.

nodes.title: How to Encode and Decode URL in Magento 2Â
nodes.excerpt: Introduction: In the world of e-commerce, it is essential to have a robust and secure platform to manage your online store. Magento 2, an open-source e-commerce platform, offers a variety of features and functionalities to help merchants run their online store efficiently. One important aspect of Magento 2 is encoding and decoding URLs, which is … Read more
nodes.content:
Introduction:

In the world of e-commerce, it is essential to have a robust and secure platform to manage your online store. Magento 2, an open-source e-commerce platform, offers a variety of features and functionalities to help merchants run their online store efficiently. One important aspect of Magento 2 is encoding and decoding URLs, which is crucial for security and functionality. In this blog, we will discuss How to Encode and Decode URLs in Magento 2.

What is URL Encoding and Decoding in Magento 2?

URL encoding, also known as percent-encoding, is the process of converting characters into a format that can be transmitted over the internet. It is a way to represent special characters, such as spaces and symbols, in a URL-safe format. URL decoding is the reverse process, where encoded characters are converted back into their original form.

Why is it important in Magento 2?

URL encoding and decoding play a crucial role in the security and functionality of Magento 2. When URLs are encoded, they are made safer to transmit over the internet, and when they are decoded, they can be used to access the relevant information. Encoding and decoding URLs also help to prevent cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, where malicious code is injected into a website through a URL.

How to Encode URL in Magento 2:

In Magento 2, you can encode a URL using the built-in urlencode() function. Here’s how:

1. Open your Magento 2 store’s code editor and navigate to the file where you want to encode a URL.

2. In the code editor, define a variable for the URL you want to encode. For example:

bash

$url = "http://www.example.com/products/men's-shirt";

1. Next, use the urlencode() function to encode the URL. For example:

bash

$encodedUrl = urlencode($url);

The encoded URL will look like this:

perl

http%3A%2F%2Fwww.example.com%2Fproducts%2Fmen%27s-shirt

How to Decode URL in Magento 2:

In Magento 2, you can decode a URL using the built-in urldecode() function. Here’s how:

1. Open your Magento 2 store’s code editor and navigate to the file where you want to decode a URL.

2. In the code editor, define a variable for the URL you want to decode. For example:

perl

$encodedUrl = "http%3A%2F%2Fwww.example.com%2Fproducts%2Fmen%27s-shirt";

1. Next, use the urldecode() function to decode the URL. For example:

bash

$decodedUrl = urldecode($encodedUrl);

The decoded URL will look like this:

vbnet

http://www.example.com/products/men's-shirt

Conclusion

Encoding and decoding URLs in Magento 2 is a straightforward process that can be accomplished using built-in functions. This process is important for the security and functionality of your online store, helping to prevent malicious attacks and ensuring URLs are transmitted correctly. By this, you can ensure that your online store remains secure and runs smoothly.

In conclusion, URL encoding and decoding are essential components of any e-commerce platform, and Magento 2 provides easy-to-use functions for these processes. Whether you’re looking to improve the security of your online store or simply make sure that your URLs are correctly formatted, encoding and decoding URLs in Magento 2 is a simple and effective solution. By following the steps outlined in this blog, you can easily keep your online store running smoothly and securely.

Please follow and like us:
Aaron Jenkins

I am Aaron Jenkins, a Magento Developer with over 12+ years of experience. I specialize in Magento 2 and I am passionate about sharing my knowledge and experience through my blog. Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.

nodes.title: How to Get Product Image URL in Magento 2
nodes.excerpt: Magento 2 is an open-source e-commerce platform that provides a wide range of features and functionalities to manage and customize an online store. With its user-friendly interface and robust architecture, Magento 2 enables merchants to easily create and manage their product catalog, process orders, handle shipping and tax settings, manage customer accounts and more. One … Read more
nodes.content:
Magento 2 is an open-source e-commerce platform that provides a wide range of features and functionalities to manage and customize an online store. With its user-friendly interface and robust architecture, Magento 2 enables merchants to easily create and manage their product catalog, process orders, handle shipping and tax settings, manage customer accounts and more. One of the most important aspects of an e-commerce store is product images, as they help customers visualize the product and make informed purchasing decisions. 

Overall, the goal of this blog is to provide a comprehensive guide to retrieving and using the product image URL in Magento 2, to help merchants enhance the user experience on their online store and drive better results.

Hence, it’s crucial for merchants to have access to the its image URLs to use them for various purposes such as email marketing, product comparison, or to simply display on their website. In this article, we will discuss how to get product image URL in Magento 2, and the different ways to use it to enhance the user experience on your online store.

What are the Needs to get Image URL in Magento 2 

There are several reasons why it’s important to get it done. Some of these reasons include:

Product Comparison: 

Its image URLs can be used to display product images in a product comparison page. This allows customers to compare the different products side-by-side and make informed purchasing decisions.

Email Marketing: 

Product image URLs can be used to include product images in email marketing campaigns, such as product promotion emails, newsletter, or abandoned cart recovery emails. This can help to increase customer engagement and drive sales.

Product Pages: 

It can be used to unhide all product images on product pages. This helps customers to visualize the product thoroughly and makes it easier for them to decide whether to purchase it or not.

Third-Party Integrations: 

Its image URLs can be used to integrate your Magento 2 store with other platforms, such as social media or marketplace websites. This allows you to showcase you it on these platforms and reach a wider audience.

Custom Templates: 

It’s image URLs can be used to display product images in custom templates, such as custom product listings or category pages. This can help you to create a more personalized and unique shopping experience for your customers.

Overall, getting its URL in Magento 2 is essential for merchants to effectively manage and display images on their online store, and to drive better results.

Steps to get product image url in Magento 2

There are two ways to get product image URL in Magento 2:

1. Using Product Repository

These class is a convenient way to retrieve its data from the database. You can use this class to get the product image URL by loading the product and then getting the image URL from the product object.

To get the its URL using the above given Repository class, you need to follow these steps:

1. First, you need to create an instance of its Repository class in your class.

php

protected $_productRepository;

public function __construct(

    \Magento\Catalog\Api\ProductRepositoryInterface $productRepository

) {

    $this->_productRepository = $productRepository;

}

2. Load the product using the Product Repository class.

bash

$product = $this->_productRepository->getById($productId);

3. Get the image URL from the product object.

bash

$imageUrl = $product->getImageUrl();

2. Using Object Manager

The Object Manager is a class that is responsible for instantiating objects in Magento 2. You can use the Object Manager to get the product image URL by loading it and then getting the image URL from the product object.

To get the image URL using the Object Manager, you need to follow these steps:

1. First, you need to create an instance of the Object Manager class in your class.

php

protected $_objectManager;

public function __construct(

    \Magento\Framework\ObjectManagerInterface $objectManager

) {

    $this->_objectManager = $objectManager;

}

2. Load the product using the Object Manager.

bash

$product = $this->_objectManager->create('Magento\Catalog\Model\Product')->load($productId);

3. Get the image URL from the product object.

bash

$imageUrl = $product->getImageUrl();

Conclusion

In this article, we have discussed two ways to get the product image URL in Magento 2. Both ways are simple and easy to use. You can choose the method that suits your needs and implement it in your store. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to ask.

Please follow and like us:
Aaron Jenkins

I am Aaron Jenkins, a Magento Developer with over 12+ years of experience. I specialize in Magento 2 and I am passionate about sharing my knowledge and experience through my blog. Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.

nodes.title: How to use Advanced Reporting functionality in Magento 2
nodes.excerpt: Operating an eCommerce business in today’s market presents numerous challenges, from attracting customers to convincing them to make a purchase. With increasing competition, it’s crucial for online retailers to differentiate themselves and offer personalized experiences. This is where Business Intelligence (BI) comes in. As a widely used BI tool, it allows businesses to use data-driven … Read more
nodes.content:
Operating an eCommerce business in today’s market presents numerous challenges, from attracting customers to convincing them to make a purchase. With increasing competition, it’s crucial for online retailers to differentiate themselves and offer personalized experiences.

This is where Business Intelligence (BI) comes in. As a widely used BI tool, it allows businesses to use data-driven insights to make informed decisions.

In this post, we’ll explore How to use Advanced Reporting functionality in Magento 2 and its impact on enhancing your eCommerce business with Magento Business Intelligence.

How to Use Advanced Reporting Functionality in Magento 2: A Comprehensive Guide

Magento 2 Advanced Reporting is a free tool that is only available for its installations. However, there are some prerequisites you should be aware of to use it effectively for your online store.

Who can use Magento 2 Advanced Reporting and Requirements?

Here are the requirements:

1. Your website must run on a public web service.

2. A valid SSL certificate for your domain.

3. A Magento store that has been installed or upgraded without any errors.

4. A single base currency since the time of installation (Advanced Reporting only works for Magento installations that use a single base currency).

5. Correct Base URL settings in the Magento configuration, with the store view pointing to a secure URL and “Use Secure URLs” enabled on both the storefront and in the admin panel.

6. A successful creation of the Magento crontab at the store’s backend, with no issues with the cron jobs on the server.

Please note that it may take up to a day for Reporting to collect and analyze data for How to use Advanced Reporting functionality in Magento 2. To avoid system overload during peak times, it’s recommended to set a preferred time of day for data collection.

How to use Magento 2 Advanced Reporting

Step 1: Enable Advanced Reporting in the Store’s Backend

To activate How to use Advanced Reporting functionality in Magento 2, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to Stores > Settings > Configuration in the Magento store’s backend.
  2. Select Advanced Reporting in the General section.
  3. Configure settings such as enabling the Advanced Reporting Service, setting a preferred time for data collection, and personalizing analytics for your industry.
  4. Click “Save Config” when finished.

Remember to verify your subscription status and ensure your installation meets all necessary conditions.

Step 2: View the Results in the Admin Panel

Now that you’ve completed the setup, it’s time to see the results of Magento 2 Advanced Reporting. To access the dashboard, go to Reports > Business Intelligence > Advanced Reporting in the Admin Panel.

The dashboard consists of three main tabs: Orders, Customers, and Products. Each tab provides various reports to help you understand your business performance.

Orders: Includes 12 different reports on metrics like Revenue, AOV, Tax, and Shipping fees.

Customers: Contains 4 reports on Unique Customers, New Registered Accounts, Top Coupon Users, and Customer KPI

Access Data resources from the Advanced Reporting dashboard

In the Magento 2 Reporting dashboard, users can quickly access the Data Resources by clicking on the Additional Resources button located in the upper-right corner. The Data Resources offer helpful information through three main sections: Thought Leadership, Support, and Business Intelligence. These resources provide valuable insights and guidance for businesses using the Reporting feature.

The bottom line!

In conclusion, the Advanced Reporting functionality in it provides a comprehensive solution for businesses to track and analyze data, make informed decisions, and enhance their eCommerce operations. Understanding how to effectively use this feature is essential for online retailers to stay ahead of the competition and deliver personalized experiences to their customers. If you’re looking for a guide on how to use Magento 2 Advanced Reporting, check out our comprehensive guide for advanced reports for Magento 2. With this guide, you’ll learn how to unlock the full potential of this powerful feature and take your eCommerce business to the next level.

Additionally, learning about the inner workings of a platform like Magento 2 is crucial, which is why it is important to also understand What is a Repository in Magento 2. Knowledge of this topic will give you a deeper understanding of how Magento 2 functions and allow you to better utilize its features like Advanced Reporting.

Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.

nodes.title: How to Update or Remove Existing Menu in Magento 2
nodes.excerpt: Magento 2 is an open-source e-commerce platform that offers an array of features and functionalities for merchants to manage their online store. To setup Magento 2 is a straightforward process with its user-friendly interface, making it easy to customize and configure the store to meet specific business needs. One crucial aspect of an online store … Read more
nodes.content:
Magento 2 is an open-source e-commerce platform that offers an array of features and functionalities for merchants to manage their online store. To setup Magento 2 is a straightforward process with its user-friendly interface, making it easy to customize and configure the store to meet specific business needs. One crucial aspect of an online store is the navigation menu, which acts as a roadmap for customers to find the products they want. A well-designed navigation menu can significantly enhance the user experience and increase the chances of a customer making a purchase.

In this blog, we will go over the steps involved in how to update or remove existing menu in Magento 2. Whether you want to change the name of a menu item, add new categories, or delete outdated menus, this guide will help you make the necessary changes in no time. With the flexibility and scalability of Magento 2, you can ensure your online store stays ahead of the curve and meets the evolving needs of your customers.

Prerequisites:

To follow this tutorial, you should have a basic knowledge of Magento 2 and its file structure. You should also have a basic understanding of PHP.

Updating an Existing Menu in Magento 2:

Magento 2 provides a user-friendly interface to create and update menus. To update an existing menu in Magento 2, follow the below steps:

Step 1: Log in to the Magento 2 Admin panel.

Step 2: Navigate to the Content > Elements > Menus.

Step 3: Select the menu that you want to update.

Step 4: Make the required changes to the menu.

Step 5: Click on the Save Menu button to save the changes.

Alternatively, you can also update the menu programmatically by updating the XML file of the menu. To update the menu programmatically, follow the below steps:

Step 1: Create a custom module or use an existing module.

Step 2: Create a new XML file with the below code.

xml

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<menu xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="urn:magento:module:Magento_Backend:etc/menu.xsd">

    <update id="Magento_Catalog::catalog" title="Catalog" module="Magento_Catalog" sortOrder="10" resource="Magento_Catalog::catalog"/>

</menu>

In the above XML code, the id attribute specifies the ID of the menu item that needs to be updated, and the title attribute specifies the new title of the menu item.

Step 3: Create a new file menu.xml in the etc/adminhtml directory of your module and add the below code.

xml

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<config xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="urn:magento:framework:Module/etc/module.xsd">

    <module name="Vendor_Module" setup_version="1.0.0">

        <sequence>

            <module name="Magento_Backend"/>

        </sequence>

    </module>

</config>

In the above code, replace Vendor_Module with the name of your module.

Removing an Existing Menu in Magento 2:

To remove an existing menu in Magento 2, follow the below steps:

Step 1: Log in to the Magento 2 Admin panel.

Step 2: Navigate to the Content > Elements > Menus.

Step 3: Select the menu that you want to remove.

Step 4: Click on the Delete button to remove the menu.

Alternatively, you can also remove the menu programmatically by removing the XML file of the menu. To remove the menu programmatically, follow the below steps:

Step 1: Identify the XML file of the menu that you want to remove. The XML file can be found in the following directory:

xml

app/code/[Vendor]/[Module]/view/adminhtml/menu.xml

Step 2: Delete the XML file of the menu.

Best Practices for Updating or Removing Menus in Magento 2

Keep the Navigation Simple: It is important to keep the navigation menu simple and easy to understand, so that customers can easily find the products they are looking for.

Test Your Changes: Before making changes to your menus, it is a good idea to test the changes on a staging site to make sure that the changes have the desired effect.

Keep Your Menus Up-to-Date: Regularly review and update your menus to reflect changes in your product catalog, and to remove unused menus.

Conclusion

Conclusively, updating or removing existing menus in Magento 2 is a crucial task for merchants who want to maintain a user-friendly and up-to-date online store. By following the instructions provided in this blog, you can effortlessly update or remove existing menus in Magento 2. Ensuring your menus are kept simple, conducting thorough testing of your changes, and consistently reviewing and updating your menus can guarantee your customers have a positive experience while shopping on your online store.

Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.

nodes.title: How to Improve Payment Restrictions in Magento 2
nodes.excerpt: How to improve payment restrictions in Magento 2: An efficient payment system is a crucial aspect of any store, and it is the responsibility of an executive manager or owner to ensure that it operates smoothly. On the Magento platform by Adobe, the default payment options are limited and do not support conditional payments. The … Read more
nodes.content:
How to improve payment restrictions in Magento 2: An efficient payment system is a crucial aspect of any store, and it is the responsibility of an executive manager or owner to ensure that it operates smoothly. On the Magento platform by Adobe, the default payment options are limited and do not support conditional payments.

The checkout process is the deciding factor in whether a customer will complete a purchase or abandon their cart. It is essential to make this process seamless and user-friendly, especially with regard to shipping and payment options. Magento 2 payment restrictions can be configured to improve customer satisfaction by allowing them to choose different payment methods and shipping options for each purchase. This flexibility can increase the likelihood of customers making successful transactions. Therefore, it is important to understand how to configure Magento 2 payment restrictions to ensure that your store can offer a smooth and personalized checkout experience.

How to Improve Payment Restrictions in Magento 2: A Guide to Streamlining Your Store’s Checkout Process

Limitations imposed by the default system on payments and potential issues that may arise

The default Magento platform offers multiple shipping carrier options for each store but lacks a flexible mechanism for customization. The store owner can only restrict a shipping carrier or its method for the entire store. However, there are solutions available to improve the shipping restrictions in Magento 2.

One such solution is an extension that provides a flexible way to develop a shipping policy for your store. With the help of this extension, you can easily manage available shipping methods from carriers based on various conditions to provide customers with cost-effective and customized shipping options. This can improve the checkout process for your customers and increase their satisfaction with your store.

In addition to customizing shipping options, it is also possible to improve payment restrictions in Magento 2. By customizing payment options based on different conditions, you can provide customers with personalized payment methods that suit their needs. Knowing how to improve payment restrictions in Magento 2 is an important consideration for any eCommerce store looking to provide a smooth and user-friendly checkout experience for its customers.

This extension offers several advantages for a store:

1. Cost-effective shipping: it allows creating of a flexible system of usable shipping methods to deliver orders, optimizing the available methods and offering customers the most convenient and economical delivery options.

2. Optimizing shipping to distant locations: it allows you to adjust the list of available shipping methods for distant orders to provide customers with high-quality delivery services. You can control delivery strategies for every location by setting geographical areas and limiting transportation methods.

3. Flexibility in restricting shipping methods: it allows you to create a flexible composition of restrictions for shipping methods based on a logical set of conditions such as order and cart attributes.

A system can be created based on a shopping basket list and order attributes by combining a set of predefined conditions. This way, the delivery limitation automation can determine the best rule from the available options for the current situation.

1. Ideal delivery for items: delivery methods can be selected based on item properties, using these properties as restrictions for unsuitable delivery methods.

2. Preventing dangerous transportation for delicate, perishable, or high-value items: item properties can be set as restrictions to precisely determine the available transportation methods for the requested items.

3. Definitively applying restrictions: shipping methods can be restricted for specific customer segments by selecting one or multiple segments at once to apply the restriction rule. Limitation rules can be made for specific carriers in general or set limitations for any of their proposed delivery methods.

4. The checkout process can be made more straightforward for customers by clarifying the specific restrictions on delivery methods.

5. Straightforward for customers: a custom message can be created to be displayed when a limitation rule is applied. This message can be used to promote deals by informing customers on how to unblock a specific delivery method.

6. Automated activation of delivery limitations: delivery limitations can be activated for a specific date or time. One or multiple days can be set for each limitation.

7. Improving daily practice: less time is needed to create identical restriction rules. Restrictions can be made applicable to various geographical delivery zones by setting one virtual area and allowing or prohibiting specific geographical areas.

8. Using delivery methods for promotional purposes: the store’s transportation methods can be used for advertising and controlling which delivery methods are available for various payment providers.

Summary

In conclusion, payment restrictions are an essential aspect of the checkout process in any eCommerce store. With Magento 2, merchants have the ability to configure these restrictions to provide customers with a personalized and seamless checkout experience. By allowing customers to choose from multiple payment options and shipping methods, you can increase the likelihood of successful transactions and improve customer satisfaction. Therefore, it’s important to understand how to improve payment restrictions in Magento 2 to optimize your eCommerce store and ensure that your customers have a positive shopping experience.

As a store owner, you can enhance the customer experience of purchasing your products and increase conversion rates by utilizing additional Magento 2 extensions, such as creating coupon codes. Learn how to create coupon codes in Magento 2.

Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.

nodes.title: How to Add and Configure Gift Wrap in Magento 2 ?
nodes.excerpt: Magento 2 is a cutting-edge e-commerce platform that offers unparalleled customization and scalability for businesses of all sizes. With its robust set of features and functionalities, merchants can effortlessly create and manage online stores. One of the standout features that elevates the customer shopping experience is the gift wrapping option. This unique feature allows customers … Read more
nodes.content:
Magento 2 is a cutting-edge e-commerce platform that offers unparalleled customization and scalability for businesses of all sizes. With its robust set of features and functionalities, merchants can effortlessly create and manage online stores.

One of the standout features that elevates the customer shopping experience is the gift wrapping option. This unique feature allows customers to request gift wrapping for their purchased items, adding a personal touch to their gifts. This becomes especially valuable for special occasions like birthdays, anniversaries, holidays, and other events where customers aim to present their gifts in a thoughtful and elegant manner. Leveraging to create configurable products in Magento 2, you can offer gift wrapping as a configurable option during the checkout process, giving customers the flexibility to choose.

What makes this gift wrap option truly exceptional is that it can be tailored to align with your store’s brand. Customers can select from a variety of wrapping papers, ribbons, and notes, allowing for a customized and branded gift wrapping experience. This feature not only enhances customer satisfaction but also fosters customer loyalty, ultimately driving sales for your online store. Elevate your customers’ gift-giving experience with Magento 2’s gift wrapping option and create a memorable impression that reflects your brand’s unique identity. Upgrade your online store with this exceptional feature today!

In this blog, we will guide you through the steps of how to add and configure gift wrap in Magento 2.

Features of Gift Wrapping in Magento 2 

Gift Wrapping for Individual Items: 

Magento 2 allows customers to choose gift wrapping for individual items in their cart, rather than for the entire order. This feature can be configured in the “Stores” section under the “Checkout” tab in the Magento 2 admin panel.

Gift Wrapping Message: 

Magento 2 also provides the option to include a gift wrapping message along with the wrapped items. This feature can be enabled in the “Stores” section under the “Checkout” tab in the Magento 2 admin panel.

Gift Wrapping Templates: 

Magento 2 allows you to create custom gift wrapping templates to use for your gift wrap products. These templates can be designed to match your store’s branding and can be uploaded in the “Stores” section under the “Design” tab in the Magento 2 admin panel.

Gift Wrapping Report: 

Magento 2 provides a gift wrapping report in the admin panel that shows the total number of gift wrap orders and the amount of revenue generated from gift wrap sales. This report can be accessed in the “Reports” section under the “Sales” tab in the Magento 2 admin panel.

Gift Wrapping for Virtual Products: 

It’s important to note that gift wrapping is not available for virtual products, such as digital products or services, as they cannot be physically wrapped.”

Steps to add and configure gift wrap in Magento 2 

Step 1: Open Command Line Interface (CLI)

To get started, open your preferred command line interface (CLI) or terminal window. Make sure you have SSH access to your Magento 2 installation, as you will need to run commands to configure gift wrap.

Step 2: Enter Magento 2 Root Directory

Navigate to the root directory of your Magento 2 installation using the ‘cd’ command. For example:

bash

cd /var/www/html/magento2

Replace ‘/var/www/html/magento2’ with the path to your Magento 2 installation.

Step 3: Run the Gift Wrap Command

Magento 2 provides a built-in command to add gift wrap functionality. Run the following command in your CLI:

arduino

php bin/magento setup:upgrade

This command will update your Magento 2 installation and enable the gift wrap feature.

Step 4: Configure Gift Wrap Options

Once the gift wrap feature is enabled, you can configure the gift wrap options. Run the following command:

bash

php bin/magento giftwrap:configure

This command will prompt you to enter the gift wrap options, such as the gift wrap title, price, and tax class. You can customize these options according to your business needs.

Step 5: Set Gift Wrap as a Configurable Product Option

Next, you need to set gift wrap as a configurable product option, so customers can select it during the checkout process. Run the following command:

bashÂ 

php bin/magento giftwrap:assign

This command will prompt you to select the configurable product to which you want to assign the gift wrap option. Choose the desired product and save the configuration.

Step 6: Customize Gift Wrap Design

You can also customize the design of your gift wrap to match your store’s brand. Magento 2 allows you to specify different wrapping papers, ribbons, and notes. Run the following command:

bash

php bin/magento giftwrap:design

This command will prompt you to enter the design options, such as the wrapping paper color, ribbon style, and note template. You can customize these options to create a unique and personalized gift wrap design for your customers.

Conclusion

Enhancing the shopping experience for your customers with gift wrapping in Magento 2 is a breeze. By following the simple steps provided in this blog, you can easily add and configure the gift wrap option in your Magento 2 store within minutes. If you encounter any challenges, feel free to seek guidance from a skilled Magento developer for assistance. Your customers will appreciate the thoughtful touch of gift wrapping, making their shopping experience even more delightful. Don’t hesitate to elevate your online store with this valuable feature. So, get started and impress your customers with the gift wrap option in Magento 2! Happy wrapping! .

Here, I will be sharing tutorials, tips, and best practices for all things Magento 2. Follow my blog and let’s learn and grow together.
